intro: Cheiranthus arenicola, commonly known as the sandrocket, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions. It has a low, spreading growth habit with linear leaves and produces yellow or white flowers that bloom in early spring. Cheiranthus arenicola is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open fields.
